meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny, folks! It's time to get our groove on and dive into the world of Braid: Anniversary Edition. I'm not saying I'm the best reviewer out there (hello, critics!), but I'll give it my all to make this review a fun read for young players like you.

So, what's all the fuss about? Well, let me tell you - Braid is no ordinary game. It's like a puzzle-filled, platforming masterpiece that's been around since 2008. Yes, you read that right - 16 years ago! And yet, it remains as cleverly unique today as it was back then.

Now, I know what you're thinking: "Why should I care about some old game?" Well, let me tell you why. Braid is not just any old game; it's a classic indie title that revolutionized the gaming landscape. And with this Anniversary Edition, you get to experience the game in all its enhanced glory.

But don't just take my word for it! The critics are raving about this remastered edition too. God is a Geek gives it a 90/100, saying it's "a reminder of how good the original was." Metro GameCentral agrees, calling it "a classic indie game that remains as cleverly unique today as it did 16 years ago."

And then there are those who are a bit more...mixed. Push Square says it's still a must-play for newcomers, but for those who have experienced Braid before, there might not be enough new content to justify double dipping.

Now, I know some of you might be thinking, "Wait, what about the gameplay?" Ah, yes! The gameplay is where this game truly shines. It's like a beautifully crafted puzzle box that keeps you engaged and entertained. And don't even get me started on the visuals - oh my, it's like looking at a work of art!

So, if you're new to Braid or just looking for a fun, challenging experience, then this Anniversary Edition is definitely worth checking out. Even if you've played the original before, it's still a great way to revisit an old friend.

And that's my two cents on Braid: Anniversary Edition! What do you think? Have you played the original or are you new to this amazing game? Let me know in the comments below!

P.S. Don't forget to check out the critics' reviews too - they're always good for a laugh (or a groan, depending on how much of a grump you are)!
